etymology.description: 一(一) (yī, "one") + 冓(冓) ("the shape of a basket repeatedly woven from bamboo") = signifies repeating an action -> meaning "again"
etymology.interpretation: The character 再(zài, "again") incorporates the idea of repetition using a basket shape that suggests a repeated weaving process, conveying doing something "again." This aligns with its modern usage indicating recurrence.

parts.english: the shape of a basket repeatedly woven from bamboo

examples.chinese: 请再试一次(請再試一次)。
吃完饭(吃完飯)，我们再出发(我們再出發)。
examples.pinyin: Chī wán fàn, wǒmen zài chūfā.
examples.english: After eating, we set off again.

examples.chinese: 他再读了一遍(他再讀了一遍)。
